strapiPost.title: Discover Northwest Arkansas's Ballet Culture
strapiPost.content:
There are several opportunities to enjoy the beauty of dance and ballet in NWA, beginning with Visceral Dance Chicago performing tonight at Walton Arts Center, Ozark Ballet Theater's Snow White this weekend, and NWA Ballet Theatre's Radiant, showing six times in four venues over the next month.

  • Apples: Ozark Ballet Theater presents Snow White this weekend Apr 22-23, at the Medium in Springdale, a classic fairytale ballet inspired by the Walt Disney animation and featuring choreography by Vadim Fedotov, set design by Katie Stasse and music composed by Bogdan Pavlovsky.
  • Gleaming: The Northwest Arkansas Ballet Theatre's spring tour of Radiant, featuring five pieces by new artistic director, Stephen Wynne, will be performed across four cities, the first show set for Apr 29 at the Fayetteville Public Library.

Keep up with the local ballet and dance on social media by following Ozark Ballet Theater HERE and NWA Ballet Theatre HERE.
